register.description: This register controls the DSP power state to reach upon a domain sleep transition

bitfield.description: DSP_EDMA state when domain is ON.

bitenum.description: Memory bank is on when the domain is ON.

bitfield.description: DSP_L2 state when domain is ON.

bitenum.description: Memory bank is on when the domain is ON.

bitfield.description: DSP_L1 state when domain is ON.

bitenum.description: Memory bank is on when the domain is ON.

bitfield.description: DSP_EDMA state when domain is RETENTION.

bitenum.description: Memory bank is retained when domain is in RETENTION state.

bitfield.description: DSP_L2 state when domain is RETENTION.

bitenum.description: Memory bank is off when the domain is in the RETENTION state.
Memory bank is retained when domain is in RETENTION state.

bitfield.description: DSP_L2 state when domain is RETENTION.

bitenum.description: Memory bank is off when the domain is in the RETENTION state.
Memory bank is retained when domain is in RETENTION state.

bitfield.description: Power state change request when domain has already performed a sleep transition. Allows going into deeper low power state without waking up the power domain.

bitenum.description: Do not request a low power state change.
Request a low power state change. This bit is automatically cleared when the power state is effectively changed or when power state is ON.

bitfield.description: Logic state when power domain is RETENTION

bitenum.description: Only retention registers are retained and remaing logic is off when the domain is in RETENTION state.
Whole logic is retained when domain is in RETENTION state.

bitfield.description: Power state control

register.description: This register provides a status on the DSP domain current power state. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Last low power state entered. Set to 0x3 upon write of the same only. This register is intended for debug purpose only.

bitenum.description: Power domain was previously in RETENTION

bitfield.description: Domain transition status

bitenum.description: No ongoing transition on power domain
Power domain transition is in progress.

bitfield.description: DSP_EDMA memory state status
DSP_L2 memory state status
DSP_L1 memory state status
Logic state status
Current power state status

register.description: This register controls the release of the DSP sub-system resets.

bitfield.description: DSP - MMU, cache and slave interface reset control

bitenum.description: Reset is cleared for the MMU, cache and slave interface
Reset is asserted for the MMU, cache and slave interface

bitfield.description: DSP - DSP reset control

bitenum.description: Reset is cleared for the DSP - DSP
Reset is asserted for the DSP - DSP

register.description: This register logs the different reset sources of the DSP domain. Each bit is set upon release of the domain reset signal. Must be cleared by software. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: DSP DSP processor has been reset due to DSP emulation reset request driven from DSPSS

bitenum.description: DSP DSP has been reset upon emulation reset request

bitfield.description: DSP domain has been reset due to emulation reset source e.g. assert reset command initiated by the icepick module

bitenum.description: DSP has been reset upon emulation reset

bitfield.description: DSP MMU, cache and slave interface software reset status

bitenum.description: MMU, cache and slave interface has been reset upon software reset

bitfield.description: DSP DSP software reset

bitenum.description: DSP has been reset upon software reset

register.description: This register contains dedicated DSP context statuses. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Specify if memory-based context in DSP_EDMA memory bank has been lost due to a previous power transition or other reset source.
Specify if memory-based context in DSP_L2 memory bank has been lost due to a previous power transition or other reset source.
Specify if memory-based context in DSP_L1 memory bank has been lost due to a previous power transition or other reset source.
Specify if RFF-based context has been lost due to a previous power transition or other reset source. (set upon assertion of DSP_RET_RST signal)
Specify if DFF-based context has been lost due to a previous power transition or other reset source. (set upon assertion of DSP_SYS_RST signal)
